intro: Polyosma borneensis, commonly known as the Bornean polyosma, is a flowering plant native to the rainforests of Borneo. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many species of shrubs and trees. The plant is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves and small, white to pale yellow flowers. It typically grows in shaded, humid environments and is often found in the understorey of dense tropical forests. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
